result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy J. Staves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billy J. Staves

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice - Return to Sender, Moved Left No Address, Unable to Forward
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

3:42 PM Cases called: 22CF947, 22CM588, 22CM757, 22CT45 & 22CT298. Defendant Billy J. Staves in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Billy J. Staves. Attorney Rachel Robole appeared. Attorney Andrew Gunderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have an agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1 in 22CF947: Neglecting a Child and Count 4 in 22CF947: Possession of Methamphetamine
Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1 in 22CM588: Misd Retail Theft and Count 1 in 22CM757: Misd Retail Theft
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 in 22CT298: Operating While Revoked

Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders:
on Count 1 in 22CM757: Misd Retail Theft and Count 1 in 22CT298: Operating While Revoked: court costs and surcharges and DNA sample. 
on Count 1 in 22CM588: Misd Retail Theft - court costs and surcharges, DNA sample and restitution in the amount of $ with 10% surcharge.
on 22CF947 on each count concurrent: 3 years Probation sentence withheld with conditions
Conditions of Probation:
Participate in and successfully complete treatment court. If treatment court is not successfully completed, any remaining stayed jail time will need to be served. 
9 months jail with Huber or electronic monitoring if jail and treatment court team deems him eligible: last 8 months stayed pending further order of the court. Remaining 30 days to be served immediately - should treatment court team decide defendant should initially serve less than 30 days, the team will file a motion with the Court for the Court's consideration. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Comply with DHS conditions and requirements.
court costs.

64 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation. 
Any remaining counts in these cases and all of 22CT45 is ordered dismissed and read in.
Status conference on October 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

9:39 AM cases 22CM757, 22CT45, 22CT298, 22CM588. Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Billy J. Staves in court, in custody with Attorney Rachel Allison Robole. Attorney Robole states there is an agreement in these files along with felony case which has a hearing set for tomorrow. Request is made to have these cases be heard along with 22CF947.

Status Conference set for 10/19/2022 at 3:30 PM.

9:34 AM cases 22CM588, 22CM757, 22CT45, 22CT298 called. Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Billy J. Staves in court, in custody with Attorney Rachel Allison Robole.

Initial appearance 22CT298 and 22CM757: Defense waives reading of Complaint and bond is set covering both files. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 09/26/2022 at 3:15 PM
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
